question:
You are currently trying to improve your knowledge of a language which is not your first language.You have a friend who speaks this language fluently.You have decided to write to this friend


Write a letter to your friend.In your letter,


Explain why you want to improve your knowledge of this language 
ask him/her for suggestions on how to learn more quickly.
propose that you meet your friend to talk about it.
Write at least 150 words.
text: I hope this letter finds you well. I am sorry for not having been in touch recently. Life is a bit hectic. I am writing this letter to reach out for help from you regarding learning Japanese.

As you might remember, although I have been working in the Japanese company for 4 years, I haven’t been promoted as I only know a tiny amount of knowledge of this language. Last month, our manager told us the person who is able to speak Japanese fluently would get a promotion opportunity. I incredibly would love to get this chance to go to a further step in my career.
I know your major was Professional Japanese when you were studying at university. I wonder if you could share with me several methods in terms of how to study this language quickly.

I would like to invite you to come to my home this weekend to talk about your experience of learning this language, which would be extremely beneficial to me. If you just simply don’t have time, I can completely understand.
Drop me a line at your earliest convenience to let me know whether you are able to spare a moment to discuss me.
